properties.participant: JoAnne Page will meet at Castle Gardens to lead tour.
properties.notes:
1.) New, 11-story, 114-unit building. 20,000 SF office, meeting, community spaces for supportive service programs. Includes 50 studio units for formerly incarcerated residents. All units are designated for residents earning below 60% of area median income, while rental subsidies through Section 8 and NY/NY III make many of the units affordable to residents with little or no income.
2.) The project follows rigorous green design standards, seeking LEED-NC Gold Certification, as well as participating in programs from Enterprise Green Communities and NYSERDA. An extensive green roof features a rain water harvesting system and allows residents to take advantage of unobstructed views of the Hudson River.
3.) Enterprise provided a $50k EGC grant
4.) Castle Gardens is adjacent to the Fortune Academy:
   4.1) 33 units for formerly incarcerated residents - 27 permanent units and six units with 18 beds for emergency short-term care. Ten units accommodate people living with HIV. Enterprise provided LIHTC and grant support to the project.
properties.tour details: Drive by Bus- # 32 minutes (End) from 135th Street  Jonathan Rose projects
